abstract: British police formally apologize for behavior of undercover officers who engaged in long-term relationships with women  as part of their efforts to gather intelligence and infiltrate variety of groups; apology comes after settlement of legal action in which seven women received damages for being misled by police officers.
lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Police apologized for the behavior of officers who used intimate relationships, one nine years long, to gather intelligence and infiltrate activist groups.

headline.main: British Police Apologize for Undercover Officers’ Intimate Tactics
headline.print_headline: British Police Apologize for Undercover Officers’ Intimate Infiltration Tactics
